user.title: Connect Wiser by Feller µGateway
user.description: Enter the IP address of your µGateway and click submit. The buttons should start to flash pink and purple. Press any of the flashing buttons on the µGateway within 30 seconds to connect your Home Assistant instance.

data_description.host: The hostname or IP address of your µGateway.
data_description.username: The username to be used for the API. You can enter anything, however only one connection per username is possible. If you have multiple instances, use unique usernames.
data_description.import_user: The user to import existing Wiser configuration from (like scenes, rooms and load names). If you don't have any other systems using the API, you can choose between 'installer' (Wiser eSetup app) and 'admin' (Wiser Home app).

data_description.allow_missing_gateway_data: By default, the setup fails if fields like `fw_version` or `serial_nr` are missing for devices in the API response. Enable this option for debug purposes to disable the check. WARNING: Use with caution, this can affect entity IDs and functionality!

status_light.name: Set status light
status_light.description: Set the status light color and brightness for a µGateway device.

device.name: Device
device.description: The device (load or scene / secondary control unit).

color.name: Color
color.description: The RGB color to display on the status light.

channel.name: Channel
channel.description: The specific button on the device to control.

brightness_on.name: Brightness when on
brightness_on.description: Button illumination brightness level when the load is turned on (0–255).

brightness_off.name: Brightness when off
brightness_off.description: Button illumination brightness level when the load is turned off (0–255). When unchecked, the "Brightness when on" value is used.
